messages.content: What does your website do?

Our website helps deaf and mute people convey their messages to hearing people. Deaf people use Pakistan Sign Language (PSL) to communicate, which is then converted into text and speech so hearing people can understand. We also offer a video calling feature and a sign language search engine.
How do I sign up for an account?
To sign up, click on the 'Sign Up' button on the homepage, fill in your details, and follow the on-screen instructions.
I forgot my password. How can I reset it?
Click on 'Forgot Password' on the login page, enter your email address, and follow the instructions sent to your email to reset your password.
What is the sign language search engine?
Our sign language search engine allows users to show a sign to their camera in real-time, and the meaning of that sign will be displayed. It's designed to help people understand PSL signs easily.
How can I use the video calling feature?

To use the video calling feature, sign in to your account, go to the video call section, and follow the instructions to start a call with another user. This feature allows deaf and hearing people to communicate effectively.
What technology does your website use for sign recognition?
We use the MOBILE NET SSD model for sign recognition, which analyzes hand shapes and movements to identify Pakistan Sign Language signs.
How can I translate PSL signs to text?
You can use our sign language search engine with your camera. Show a PSL sign to the camera in real-time, and the system will display the corresponding text.
Is your website free to use?
Yes, our basic services are free. We also offer premium features and personalized lessons for a subscription fee.
How do I contact customer support?
You can contact our customer support by clicking the 'Support' link at the bottom of our website or by emailing support@signlanguagewebsite.com.
What can I find on the home page?
On the home page, you can find an overview of our services, links to sign up or log in, and access to our main features like the sign language search engine and video calling.
How do I update my profile information?
To update your profile information, go to your account settings by clicking on your profile picture at the top-right corner of the page and select 'Settings'.
What information is available about institutes?
Our website provides information about various institutes that offer sign language education and resources for the deaf community.
Can I use your website on my smartphone?
Yes, our website is compatible with most devices, including smartphones, tablets, and desktop computers. All you need is a web browser and an internet connection.
How do I log in to my account?
To log in, click on the 'Login' button at the top-right corner of the homepage, enter your email and password, and follow the on-screen instructions.
What facilities do you provide?

We provide several facilities including PSL translation to text and speech, a video calling feature for communication between deaf and hearing people, and a sign language search engine with camera support.
How does your website help hearing people understand PSL?
Our website converts PSL signs into text and speech, making it easier for hearing people to understand and communicate with the deaf community.
How accurate is the sign language recognition?
Our sign language recognition system has an accuracy rate of over 90% for common PSL signs, and we are continuously working to improve it.
What should I do if my video call isn't working?

If your video call isn't working, please check your internet connection, ensure your camera and microphone are functioning, and try refreshing the page. If the problem persists, contact our support team for assistance.
Can I practice PSL on your website?
Yes, we offer a variety of tutorials and interactive lessons to help you practice and improve your PSL skills.
How do I use the real-time camera for sign translation?

To use the real-time camera feature, go to the sign language search engine section, allow camera access when prompted, and show a PSL sign to your camera. The system will display the translation in text.
What is the Pakistan Sign Language sign for 'Help'?
In PSL, 'Help' is signed by placing your dominant hand in a thumbs-up position on top of your non-dominant palm and then moving both hands upward together.
How do I navigate the website?

Our website has a user-friendly interface. Use the navigation bar at the top to access different sections like Home, About, Tutorials, Translation, and Support. If you need further help, please let me know.
How can I learn more about Pakistan Sign Language?
You can learn more about PSL by exploring our tutorials and interactive lessons, which cover basic signs, common phrases, and advanced topics.
What is Pakistan Sign Language?
Pakistan Sign Language (PSL) is the visual language used by the Deaf community in Pakistan. It uses hand shapes, facial expressions, and body movements to convey meaning.
How can I start learning PSL?
To start learning PSL, explore our tutorials section which includes basic signs, common phrases, and interactive lessons to practice.
How do I use the search engine to find a specific PSL sign?
To use the search engine, go to the sign language search engine section, allow camera access, and show the specific PSL sign to the camera. The system will display the translation in text.
What is the PSL sign for 'Good morning'?
To sign 'Good morning' in PSL, use a combination of two signs: 'Good' (placing one hand under your chin and moving it forward) and 'Morning' (raising one arm in front of you and moving it upwards).
Can I access your website from any country?
Yes, our website is accessible from any country as long as you have an internet connection.
What browsers are supported by your website?
Our website supports most modern browsers, including Chrome, Firefox, Safari, and Edge.
How secure is my data on your website?
We prioritize your privacy and security. Our website uses encryption and other security measures to protect your data.
Can I use your service if I don't know any sign language?
Yes, our service is designed to help both signers and non-signers communicate effectively using Pakistan Sign Language.
How do I report a bug or issue with the website?
To report a bug or issue, please contact our support team through the 'Support' link at the bottom of the website or email support@signlanguagewebsite.com.
What is the PSL sign for 'Yes'?
In PSL, 'Yes' is signed by making a fist and nodding it up and down, mimicking a head nod.
What is the PSL sign for 'No'?
In PSL, 'No' is signed by extending your thumb, index finger, and middle finger, and then snapping them together, resembling a 'no' gesture.
How do I change my email address on my account?
To change your email address, go to your account settings, click on 'Edit Profile', update your email address, and save the changes.
Can I use the sign language search engine without creating an account?
Yes, you can use the sign language search engine without creating an account, but some features may be limited to registered users.
What is the PSL sign for 'Friend'?
In PSL, 'Friend' is signed by hooking the index fingers of both hands together twice.
How do I delete my account?
To delete your account, go to your account settings, click on 'Delete Account', and follow the instructions. Note that this action is irreversible.
Can I customize my profile?
Yes, you can customize your profile by updating your information and adding a profile picture in the account settings.
What is the PSL sign for 'Sorry'?
In PSL, 'Sorry' is signed by making a fist with your dominant hand and moving it in a circular motion over your chest.
What kind of tutorials are available on your website?
We offer tutorials on basic PSL signs, common phrases, and advanced topics. Our tutorials are designed to help both beginners and advanced learners.
How do I enable or disable notifications?
To enable or disable notifications, go to your account settings, find the notifications section, and adjust your preferences accordingly.
Can I use your website for business purposes?
Yes, our website can be used for business purposes, such as facilitating communication with deaf employees or clients using PSL.
What is the PSL sign for 'Family'?
In PSL, 'Family' is signed by making the letter 'F' with both hands and then drawing a circle in front of your body.
How do I change my password?
To change your password, go to your account settings, click on 'Change Password', enter your current password and your new password, then save the changes.
What is the PSL sign for 'Water'?
In PSL, 'Water' is signed by making a 'W' shape with your dominant hand and tapping your chin twice.
How do I add or remove a profile picture?
To add or remove a profile picture, go to your account settings, click on 'Edit Profile', and follow the instructions to upload or remove a picture.
Can I access the tutorials without an account?
Yes, some tutorials are accessible without an account, but for full access and personalized learning, we recommend creating an account.
What is the PSL sign for 'Food'?
In PSL, 'Food' is signed by bringing your dominant hand to your mouth in a motion as if you are eating.
How do I verify my email address?
After signing up, you will receive an email with a verification link. Click on the link to verify your email address.
What is the PSL sign for 'School'?
In PSL, 'School' is signed by clapping your hands together twice, as if mimicking the action of a teacher clapping to get attention.
How do I join a video call?
To join a video call, log in to your account, go to the video call section, and click on the link to join an ongoing call or start a new one.
What is the PSL sign for 'Hospital'?
In PSL, 'Hospital' is signed by making a cross on your upper arm with the index finger of your dominant hand.
Can I use the sign language search engine for practice?
Yes, you can use the sign language search engine to practice PSL signs by showing them to the camera and seeing the corresponding translations.
What is the PSL sign for 'Doctor'?
In PSL, 'Doctor' is signed by placing the index finger of your dominant hand on your wrist, as if taking a pulse.
How can I get notifications about new features?
To receive notifications about new features, make sure you have enabled notifications in your account settings.
What is the PSL sign for 'Home'?
In PSL, 'Home' is signed by bringing your fingers and thumb together to form a flat 'O' shape, then moving it from your chin to your cheek.
Can I request new features for the website?
Yes, you can request new features by contacting our support team through the 'Support' link or by emailing support@signlanguagewebsite.com.
What is the PSL sign for 'Work'?
In PSL, 'Work' is signed by forming both hands into fists and tapping one fist on top of the other twice.
How do I find information about PSL institutes?
You can find information about PSL institutes in the 'Institutes' section of our website, which provides details on various educational resources.
What is the PSL sign for 'Love'?
In PSL, 'Love' is signed by crossing your arms over your chest, as if hugging yourself.
Can I invite friends to join the website?
Yes, you can invite friends to join our website by sharing the sign-up link with them.
What is the PSL sign for 'Teacher'?
In PSL, 'Teacher' is signed by placing both hands near your head and then moving them outward, as if showing something from your mind.
How can I learn advanced PSL signs?
To learn advanced PSL signs, explore our advanced tutorials and interactive lessons available in the 'Tutorials' section.
What is the PSL sign for 'Stop'?
In PSL, 'Stop' is signed by holding up one hand in a flat position, palm facing outward, as if signaling to stop.
What is the PSL sign for 'How are you?'?
In PSL, 'How are you?' is signed by pointing towards the person with your index finger, then using both hands to make a thumbs-up sign while rotating them forward.
Can I reset my password if I forget it?
Yes, if you forget your password, you can reset it by clicking on 'Forgot Password' on the login page and following the instructions sent to your email.
How do I change my username?
To change your username, go to your account settings, click on 'Edit Profile', update your username, and save the changes.
Can I use the website to communicate with friends?
Yes, you can use the website's real-time camera feature to communicate with friends using PSL.
What is the PSL sign for 'Thank you'?
In PSL, 'Thank you' is signed by placing the tips of your fingers on your chin and moving your hand forward, away from your face.
How can I invite a friend to a video call?
To invite a friend to a video call, share the call link with them via email or message. They can join the call by clicking on the link.
What is the PSL sign for 'Mother'?
In PSL, 'Mother' is signed by placing the thumb of your dominant hand on your chin with the fingers extended.
Can I learn PSL at my own pace on your website?
Yes, our website offers tutorials and lessons that you can follow at your own pace to learn PSL.
What is the PSL sign for 'Father'?
In PSL, 'Father' is signed by placing the thumb of your dominant hand on your forehead with the fingers extended.
Can I see my previous translations?
Yes, you can view your previous translations by going to the 'History' section in your account settings.
How do I find sign language education institutes in Lahore?
To find sign language education institutes in Lahore, go to the 'Institutes' page on our website. You'll see a Google Map with markers indicating the locations of various institutes.
Can I see the locations of sign language institutes on a map?
Yes, you can view the locations of sign language institutes on a Google Map in the 'Institutes' section of our website.
How do I use the map to find an institute?
On the 'Institutes' page, use the Google Map to locate sign language education institutes in Lahore. Click on the markers to see more information about each institute.
Can I get directions to a sign language institute?
Yes, you can get directions by clicking on a marker on the Google Map in the 'Institutes' section. This will open a detailed view with an option to get directions.
Are the institutes listed on the map verified?
Yes, the institutes listed on the Google Map in the 'Institutes' section are verified for their credibility and quality of sign language education.
Can I contact an institute directly from the map?
Yes, you can contact an institute directly. Click on a marker on the Google Map to see the contact details of the institute.
How do I zoom in on the map to see more details?
To zoom in on the Google Map, use the '+' button or scroll with your mouse. This will give you a closer view of the institute locations.
What information is available about the institutes on the map?
When you click on a marker on the Google Map, you can see detailed information about the institute, including its name, address, contact details, and a brief description.
Can I see reviews of the sign language institutes?
Yes, some institutes may have reviews visible when you click on their marker on the Google Map in the 'Institutes' section.
How often is the map updated with new institutes?
The map is regularly updated to include new sign language education institutes in Lahore. Check back often for the latest information.
Can I customize the language settings on the website?
Yes, you can customize the language settings by going to your account settings and selecting your preferred language.
Is there a feature to bookmark my favorite signs?
Yes, you can bookmark your favorite signs by clicking on the 'Bookmark' icon next to the sign. You can access your bookmarks in your account settings.
Are there any gamified learning features on the website?
Yes, we offer interactive games and quizzes to make learning PSL more engaging and fun.
Can I track my progress while learning PSL?
Yes, you can track your progress through the tutorials and lessons in your account settings.
Is there a feature to schedule online classes with PSL instructors?
Yes, you can schedule online classes with PSL instructors through the 'Classes' section of our website.
How do I share my achievements on social media?
You can share your achievements on social media by clicking on the 'Share' button next to your achievement in your profile settings.
Can I track my daily learning streak?
Yes, you can track your daily learning streak in your profile settings. It's a great way to stay motivated!
Are there any live events or workshops conducted on the website?
Yes, we regularly host live events and workshops on various topics related to PSL. You can find more information in the 'Events' section.
How do I access the sign language dictionary on the website?
You can access the sign language dictionary by clicking on the 'Dictionary' tab in the navigation bar. It contains a comprehensive list of PSL signs.
Is there a feature to track my learning goals?
Yes, you can set and track your learning goals in your account settings. It's a great way to stay focused and motivated.
Can I connect with other users for peer learning?
Yes, you can connect with other users for peer learning through our community forums and discussion boards.
How do I report inappropriate content on the website?
You can report inappropriate content by clicking on the 'Report' button next to the content. Our moderators will review it and take appropriate action.
Are there any accessibility features for users with visual impairments?
Yes, we offer accessibility features such as screen reader support and high-contrast themes for users with visual impairments.
Can I request a feature to be added to the website?
Yes, you can request new features by contacting our support team through the 'Support' link or by emailing support@signlanguagewebsite.com.
What is the PSL sign for 'Work'?
In PSL, 'Work' is signed by forming both hands into fists and tapping one fist on top of the other twice.
How do I find information about PSL institutes?
You can find information about PSL institutes in the 'Institutes' section of our website, which provides details on various educational resources.
Can I invite friends to join the website?
Yes, you can invite friends to join our website by sharing the sign-up link with them.
What is the PSL sign for 'Teacher'?
In PSL, 'Teacher' is signed by placing both hands near your head and then moving them outward, as if showing something from your mind.
How can I learn advanced PSL signs?
To learn advanced PSL signs, explore our advanced tutorials and interactive lessons available in the 'Tutorials' section.
What is the PSL sign for 'Stop'?
In PSL, 'Stop' is signed by holding up one hand in a flat position, palm facing outward, as if signaling to stop.
